alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 09 at 3:08AM CST until February 09 at 6:00PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...SNOW WILL RESULT IN HAZARDOUS TRAVEL TODAY... .Low pressure lifting into the Great Lakes region will bring accumulating snow to the Fox Valley and lakeshore areas today. The axis of heaviest snow has shifted farther southeast, and lingering dry air will delay the onset of the snow by a few hours. North winds gusting to 25 to 35 mph will occur, but since the snow is expected to be heavy and wet, little blowing or drifting is anticipated. Travel conditions will become hazardous in some areas due to poor visibilities and snow or slush covered roads. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Calumet, Manitowoc, Winnebago, Brown, and Kewaunee Counties. * WHEN...From 9 AM this morning to 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The most significant snowfall is expected to develop after the morning commute, and should taper off before the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Wisconsin can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
